Looking at the structure and symmetry of an icosahedron, I need to determine which of these shapes cannot occur as a cross-section.

After careful analysis of the geometry, I can determine that it's impossible to obtain a decagonal (10-sided) cross-section from an icosahedron. The maximum number of sides in any cross-section of an icosahedron is 6 (hexagonal), which occurs when cutting perpendicular to certain axes.

Therefore, the answer is option A - a cross-section with 10 sides is not possible.
